5ebe4f0d-0552-435a-8f8e-486f2160008f.description: This badge will introduce you to an instructional design model for online learning, the process of course alignment and quality assurance standards for online teaching. Badge earners will apply a course mapping process to design a course organization and structure in the Canvas Learning Management System while adhering to a set of quality standards. Participants should expect to spend 24 – 36 hours to complete this badge.
5ebe4f0d-0552-435a-8f8e-486f2160008f.name: TOP: Online Course Design

issuer.summary: issued by University of Colorado Colorado Springs

badge_template_activities.title: Score greater than 85% of total points on the badge deliverables, Teaching Statement for Online Course Design, Course Alignment Plan, the Module Mapping, and the Module Alignment Assignment.
Score greater than 85% of total points on the badge deliverables, The Four Essentials in Canvas, and Online Course Syllabus.
Score greater than 85% of total points on the badge deliverable, Module Organization and Development in Canvas.
Score greater than 85% of total points on the badge deliverable, OLC Scorecard Quality Check.
Total points awarded must be greater than 85% of total points

a1b54d6b-278a-4fa4-911e-9fb50641ea6a.description: This badge introduces the Universal Design for Learning principles, a framework for optimizing teaching and learning for all learners. Participants use and create accessible digital resources, engage students in meaningful instructional activities and engagement, and provide different options for students to demonstrate knowledge. Participants should expect to spend 24 – 36 hours to complete this badge.
a1b54d6b-278a-4fa4-911e-9fb50641ea6a.name: Design with Accessibility in Mind

issuer.summary: issued by University of Colorado Colorado Springs

badge_template_activities.title: Score greater than 85% of total points on the badge deliverable, Selection of Instructional Materials and Materials designed using UDL in Canvas.
Score greater than 85% of total points on the badge deliverables associated with the development of instructional strategies and engagement include the material, activities and assessment
Score greater than 85% of total points on the badge deliverable, assessments and rubrics
Score greater than 85% of total points on the badge deliverable, ASSURE Quality Checklist.

a8d61eb2-b481-45ff-9ac0-54965348454a.description: This badge provides course management and facilitation strategies for online teaching. As part of this badge, you will evaluate your own teaching presence and student needs for interaction and engagement. You will create course interactions, activities, and assessments that foster social presence in an online course using various technology tools. Participants should expect to spend 24 – 36 hours to complete this badge.
a8d61eb2-b481-45ff-9ac0-54965348454a.name: TOP: Online Facilitation Badge

issuer.summary: issued by University of Colorado Colorado Springs

badge_template_activities.title: Score greater than 85% of total points on the badge deliverable, Use Canvas Tools to Enhance Your Teaching Presence Assignment.
Score greater than 85% of total points on the badge deliverable, Use Canvas Tools to Enhance Cognitive and Social Presence in an Online Course Assignment.
Score greater than 85% of total points on the badge deliverable, Use Canvas Tools to Apply an Online Facilitation Framework.
Score greater than 85% of total points on the badge deliverable, Use Canvas Tools to Manage the Online Learning Process
Score greater than 85% of total points on the badge deliverable, the Makerspace with Peer Review
Score greater than 85% of total points on the badge deliverable, Capstone Teaching Toolbox.

skills.name: Community Built On Diversity And Accessibility

b955e6f0-2c40-4121-acee-b028f40f3bae.description: The OER Re-User badge is the first of three levels towards earning the Open Educational Resource (OER) credential. It represents the ability to apply the first and second of the five R's (Retain, Reuse, Revise, Remix, Redistribute): Retain and Reuse. Earners of this badge have demonstrated competency in articulating rationale for using OER, locating and evaluating OER, pinpointing areas of a course where OER content could be used most effectively, and diversifying OER content for those purposes.
b955e6f0-2c40-4121-acee-b028f40f3bae.name: OER Re-User

issuer.summary: issued by University of Colorado Colorado Springs

badge_template_activities.title: Complete OER SUCCESS Part 1 with a score of 85% or higher or participation in the Awareness and Review phase of the Colorado Department of Higher Education (CDHE) OER Grant.

122488df-34a5-44aa-8827-dfa26471c825.description: The Universal Design (UD) for Inclusive Teaching badge is a comprehensive credential for proactively designing and implementing inclusive teaching strategies. It represents the ability to cultivate an inclusive educational community within courses and programs. Earners have demonstrated competency in applying Universal Design for Learning concepts to course design and teaching practices, exercising self-awareness and commitment to inclusion, and improving student success.
122488df-34a5-44aa-8827-dfa26471c825.name: Universal Design for Inclusive Teaching

issuer.summary: issued by University of Colorado Colorado Springs

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of all online modules, including all Products with an overall score of 85% or higher.
Implementation of Inclusive Teaching Strategy or Method into a course you teach
Evaluation of the Inclusive Teaching Strategy or Method
Presentation of the Inclusive Teaching Strategy or Method

skills.name: Accessibility And Inclusiveness In Course Design

a9bf93fc-a281-48f7-9c87-64302930e27b.description: The OER Remixer badge is the second level of the Open Educational Resource (OER) credential. It represents the ability to apply the third and fourth of the five R’s: Revise and Remix. Earners have demonstrated competency in identifying gaps in OER content; locating and then evaluating new content for acceptable use; revising existing OER content to align with course topics and objectives using Creative Commons licensing guidelines.
a9bf93fc-a281-48f7-9c87-64302930e27b.name: OER Remixer

issuer.summary: issued by University of Colorado Colorado Springs

badge_template_activities.title: Complete OER SUCCESS Part 2 with a score of 85% or higher or completion of the Educator Adoption/Redesign phase of the Colorado Department of Higher Education (CDHE) OER Grant.

skills.name: Accessibility And Inclusiveness In Course Design

69677c86-4a21-41f1-a353-a959b1c47098.description: The Ethics First badge is first in a series of the University of Colorado Colorado Springs College of Business Daniels Fund Ethics Initiative (DFEI) Collegiate Program Voicing Ethical Values Micro-credentialing Program. It reflects application of the DFEI decision-making process to an ethical focus area (behavior, fraud, technology, health and wellness, an organization, or sports). Earners have demonstrated competency in applying ethical principles to relevant personal/organizational practices.
69677c86-4a21-41f1-a353-a959b1c47098.name: COB: DFEI Ethics First

issuer.summary: issued by University of Colorado Colorado Springs

badge_template_activities.title: Recorded attendance of Ethics First, Ethics Roundtable, or other UCCS DFEI-related events, self-enrollment in the UCCS COB DFEI Ethics First Badge Series Canvas space. Successful completion and submission of an event-specific application activity or deliverable meeting 90% of the criteria.

f202a4c9-809b-417a-a005-1926724c999e.description: The OER Redistributor badge is the third and final level of the Open Educational Resource (OER) credential. It represents the ability to apply the fifth of the five R’s: Redistribution and signifies sharing copies of original and individual revisions and remixes of OER content that have been fully implemented and evaluated for effectiveness. Earners have demonstrated competency in fully integrating customized OER, measuring its effectiveness on student success, and facilitating use by others.
f202a4c9-809b-417a-a005-1926724c999e.name: OER Redistributor

issuer.summary: issued by University of Colorado Colorado Springs

badge_template_activities.title: Complete OER SUCCESS Part 3 with a score of 85% or higher, or completion of the Adaptation and Creation phase of the Colorado Department of Higher Education (CDHE) OER Grant.

2ed18df5-0bdf-4c89-9ec2-ed29e3c1f098.description: Participants learn the essentials of technical communication (TC) including the principles of technical writing, technical editing, document design, collaboration, and user-centered design and build a portfolio of projects that includes common technical communication genres such as technical descriptions, instructions, proposals, infographics, and various types of scientific and technical reports. Prepares you to begin deeper study and practice in the various fields of technical communication.
2ed18df5-0bdf-4c89-9ec2-ed29e3c1f098.name: Technical Communication Foundations

issuer.summary: issued by University of Colorado Colorado Springs

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of TCID 2090: TECHNICAL WRITING AND PRESENTATION - Prepares students to write effectively and ethically within technical, scientific, and engineering contexts. Students organize, design, compose, and revise clear documents and visuals both as individuals and as part of writing teams while learning to tailor their writing to an audience’s needs.

Successful completion of TCID 3120: TECHNICAL EDITING AND STYLE – Focuses on editing strategies for improving the style and clarity of technical documents. Students practice the principles of editing at various levels including developmental, comprehensive, and copy editing while building understanding of editing’s role in the document development process.

Successful completion of TCID 3130: CONTENT STRATEGY AND MANAGEMENT - Examines the history, theory, and practice of creating and delivering technical content for the Internet and mobile devices. Students develop a content strategy for a client and produce online communication materials using a database-enabled content management system for editing and publishing.

33b52403-2f6c-4d95-8677-9418fcfdd63b.description: Explores complexities involved with the adoption of security technologies, achieving regulatory compliance, and implementing cybersecurity programs to mitigate risks and secure information assets. Program enables professionals to effectively govern cybersecurity in an organization. The courses are aligned with the subject matter covered in ‘in-demand’ cybersecurity certifications of CISM, CRISC, and CISA. Must earn a C grade or higher in each class and maintain an overall cumulative GPA of 3.0.
33b52403-2f6c-4d95-8677-9418fcfdd63b.name: Cybersecurity Management Graduate Specialization

issuer.summary: issued by University of Colorado Colorado Springs

badge_template_activities.title: CYSM 6100 FUNDAMENTALS OF CYBERSECURITY TECHNOLOGIES: Examines fundamental cybersecurity technologies needed to ensure protection of critical information systems. Focus is on technical aspects of cybersecurity. Discusses cryptography, operating systems security, application security, and network security. Includes topics of principles of computer security, user authentication, access control, malicious software, denial-of-service attacks, intrusion detection, firewalls and Intrusion.

CYSM 6200 ENTERPRISE INFORMATION SECURITY: Provides understanding to effectively implement the information security vision and strategy set forth by executive management. Emphasis is on cybersecurity management including information security policy and development of a security program. Focuses on establishing security processes, information security standards, risk management (models), business continuity, contingency planning tools, and SETA (security education, training and awareness).

CYSM 6300 CYBERSECURITY GOVERNANCE: Investigates the challenges and opportunities of effectively governing an organization's information security requirements and resources. Cybersecurity governance lays out the vision for the cybersecurity program. Discusses what constitutes good cybersecurity governance, and development of an effective security strategy and policy. Also focuses on how to improve information security accountability and maturity.

CYSM 6400 CYBERSECURITY LAW AND CYBERCRIME: Examines data security and privacy laws and regulations that govern the collection, use, storage, and destruction of sensitive information. Learn about the nature of cybercrime, methods of investigating cybercrime, securing the crime scene, and collecting evidence of cybercrime. Explore the challenges involved with international cooperation in pursuing cybercrime offenders, and problems of enforcement between different international legal systems.

ea25de02-7c7b-4cdf-b7ce-64557e502921.description: This badge examines quality assurance for developing online courses. Participants explore and align their course with quality assurance standards. Participants also complete a course quality self-evaluation, a collaborative course review, and create a plan for continuous course improvement. Participants should expect to spend 24 – 36 hours to complete this badge.
ea25de02-7c7b-4cdf-b7ce-64557e502921.name: TOP: Design for Quality Assurance Badge

issuer.summary: issued by University of Colorado Colorado Springs

badge_template_activities.title: Score greater than 85% of total points Design for Quality Assurance badge deliverables.
Pass a Course Quality Assurance review with no moderate or major revisions required.
Design a course that meets the rigorous standards of the OSCQR system.

skills.name: The Process Of Instructional Design For Online Courses

0ede95bb-bfe9-43f0-8bee-bd8d3a214f2e.description: Participants learn the essentials of user experience (UX) – including research, design, iterative design, usability testing, and technological adaptability – and build a portfolio of projects that includes prototypes, user personas, and scenarios created using industry-standard tools, methods, and software. Completing the badge prepares you with the core understanding and skills to begin a successful career in the expanding profession of UX Research and Design.
0ede95bb-bfe9-43f0-8bee-bd8d3a214f2e.name: User Experience (UX) Research and Design

issuer.summary: issued by University of Colorado Colorado Springs

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of TCID 3860: USER EXPERIENCE RESEARCH METHODS - familiarizes students with the methods, techniques, and tools for understanding users and then transmitting those findings to others in effective reports. Students learn multiple methods including interviewing, creating personas, card sorting, developing journey maps, and conducting usability tests.

Successful completion of TCID 3865: USER EXPERIENCE DESIGN PRINCIPLES - Explores the role that design plays in users’ experiences of communication products and in human-computer interaction. Students use contemporary UX design tools to translate these principles into usable and understandable prototypes that include images, copy, and basic interactivity.

Successful completion of TCID 3160: TECHNOLOGICAL ADAPATABILITY - Prepares students to work with a variety of software tools to aid with collaboration, writing, and preparing professional products. Students learn to approach technology flexibly, assessing which tools are best for projects and how they aid with creating effective communication.

cd4116f9-f56d-4fc0-97e3-dd5dc20e8a39.description: Earners are ready to work in innovative startups that need to gain traction quickly and build a consumer base and in established companies that have or are developing a digital presence. Qualifications include brand management and promotion in the digital landscape, a solid foundation for digital business models, new forms of digital-based revenue and blockchain technology, how to develop and execute email, pay-per-click, and social media campaigns, and industry relevant certifications
cd4116f9-f56d-4fc0-97e3-dd5dc20e8a39.name: Digital Strategy & New Media Marketing Track

issuer.summary: issued by University of Colorado Colorado Springs

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of MKTG 4650 Promotion Management and Strategy: Emphasizes the coordinated usage of the promotions mix elements in order to synergize marketing efforts. Topics include advertising, direct marketing, internet and interactive marketing, sales promotions, public relations, and personal selling. The impact of buyer behavior on promotional strategy is examined and several communication models are analyzed.

Successful completion of MKTG 4700 Digital Marketing and Social Media Strategy: Provides a foundation and introduction into the strategy and tactics required for marketing in digital environments. The course focuses on key aspects of digital marketing currently used by professionals with particular attention given to the newest tools and techniques. Students apply concepts on a final project for real-world application in one of the most quickly changing business landscapes.

Successful completion of  STRT 4100 Digital Business Strategy and Growth: Prepares students for the new realities of business in the digital landscape. Includes a wide range of business topics that reflect changes in business strategy in the post-Internet age. Provides in-depth look at digital business models and revenue structures, design and conduct a digital-business opportunity analysis, create and deliver value through digital marketing channels, and parameters and tools for online growth.

88c5309c-ab35-4af5-bd32-16f4a66b7396.description: This self-paced course introduces inclusive course design and teaching strategies. Teamed with an FRC Instructional Designer or Teaching Fellow, faculty explore effective pedagogical strategies focused on student retention, engagement, and inclusive teaching practices. This badge focuses on awareness of bias and preferences in teaching philosophies, inclusive course design and teaching strategies, and syllabus design. Badge earners will apply inclusive practices to a course that they teach.
88c5309c-ab35-4af5-bd32-16f4a66b7396.name: Inclusive Teaching Essentials

issuer.summary: issued by University of Colorado Colorado Springs

badge_template_activities.title: Score greater than 85% of total points on the Inclusive Teaching Philosophy Statement.
Score greater than 85% of total points on the Course Plan and Schedule.
Score greater than 85% of total points on the Lesson Plan.
Score 85% or higher on Inclusive Course Syllabus.
Score 85% or higher on Inclusive First Day Activity or Icebreaker.
Score 85% or higher on Inclusive Teaching Essentials Checklist or ACCESS Action Plan

skills.name: Awareness Of Teaching Preferences And Bias

305d48ce-c970-4688-9b78-843a4ad7abe9.description: Participants learn the essentials of iterative design practices (IDP) – including tools and methods for prototyping, testing, evaluating, and creating communication products that meet the needs of specific audiences. Also includes basic project management skills used in document management projects. Completion prepares you for further study in information architecture, user experience research and design, or to transition into a career in technical communication and information design.
305d48ce-c970-4688-9b78-843a4ad7abe9.name: Iterative Design Practices

issuer.summary: issued by University of Colorado Colorado Springs

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of TCID 3140: ITERATIVE DESIGN PROJECTS - Familiarizes students with the foundational usability principles of creating, testing, revising and recreating products for maximum communication effectiveness. Students practice the process with multiple deliverables, paying careful attention to project management techniques for print, visual, and digital communication contexts

Successful completion of TCID 3160: TECHNOLOGICAL ADAPATABILITY - Prepares students to work with a variety of software tools to aid with collaboration, writing, and preparing professional products. Students learn to approach technology flexibly, assessing which tools are best for projects and how they aid with creating effective communication.

Successful completion of TCID 3865: USER EXPERIENCE DESIGN PRINCIPLES - Explores the role that design plays in users’ experiences of communication products and in human-computer interaction. Students use contemporary UX design tools to translate these principles into usable and understandable prototypes that include images, copy, and basic interactivity.

d0d5d691-22ed-4c47-a910-a245a9fc3bb3.description: The Universal Design Principles is part of the UDIT Program and is a comprehensive credential for proactively designing and implementing inclusive teaching strategies. It represents the ability to implement Universal Design for Learning (UDL) principles within courses and programs. Earners have demonstrated competency in applying UDL concepts to course design and teaching practices, exercising self-awareness and commitment to inclusion, and improving student success.
d0d5d691-22ed-4c47-a910-a245a9fc3bb3.name: UDIT | Universal Design Principles

issuer.summary: issued by University of Colorado Colorado Springs

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of all online modules, including all Products with an overall score of 85% or higher.
Implementation of Inclusive Teaching Strategy or Method into a course you teach
Evaluation of the Inclusive Teaching Strategy or Method
Presentation of the Inclusive Teaching Strategy or Method

9c7044d4-b10f-476c-b3a0-47a866bcbf7f.description: Earners understand the changing roles of managers and leaders in different management levels within the organization and understand the development and maintenance of effective relationships between employers and employees. MGMT 6000 required then complete 3 of 5 listed courses.
9c7044d4-b10f-476c-b3a0-47a866bcbf7f.name: COB: Graduate Specialization Management

issuer.summary: issued by University of Colorado Colorado Springs

badge_template_activities.title: MGMT 6000 Managing Organization Development, Change & Transformation: Designed to prepare students to succeed personally and professionally in a rapidly changing global world. Focuses on changing times and what it will take to succeed personally and organizationally, leadership and management skills and skills to bring out the best in people, teams, and organizations as well as develop skills in managing stress, time, and life.

BUAD 6700 Service Management: A multidisciplinary approach involving marketing, management, human resource management, and information and operations management. Provides a foundation in these areas as they pertain to service management. Content for each area will include a conceptual overview of its importance to service quality, specific tools representative of the area, and exercises to demonstrate practical application. The focus is on the integrative requirements of service quality.

MGMT 6200 Managing Organization Development, Change & Transformation: This course provides sound theory and practical skills in how to develop high-performing individuals, teams, and organizations, how to effectively manage change, and how to transform organizations.

MGMT 6300 Managing Human Resources for Competitive Advantage: Presents an overview of contemporary human resource management issues with an emphasis on conflict resolution and negotiation skills to enhance strategic organizational goals. Topics include the eight conflict resolution approaches, various negotiation approaches, employee recruitment, performance appraisal, employee development, reward systems, labor unions, and ethics.

MGMT 6400 Legal Issues in Human Resources: Examines legal, social, and ethical issues confronting human resource managers. Emphasis is on equal employment opportunity, affirmative action, safety and health. Includes sexual harassment, drug testing programs, employing the disabled, employee privacy rights, wrongful termination, and honesty testing. The objective for the course is to explain how organizations can manage employees legally and ethically, while maintaining a productive work force.

MGMT 6550 Applied Principles of Negotiation and Conflict Management: Students build skills and confidence through simulations of real-world negotiations. Topics include basic principles of negotiation and dispute resolution, focusing on preparation and interpersonal relationships.

dacdaae3-b63b-49a7-b642-b74f442301af.description: Participants learn the essentials of information design (ID) – including researching an audience’s needs and presenting information in a manner that translates unstructured data into information that is easily accessible, usable, and understandable to specific audiences with specific needs. Prepares you with the core understanding and skills to begin deeper study and practice as a content manager, technical communicator, information architect, or user experience designer and researcher.
dacdaae3-b63b-49a7-b642-b74f442301af.name: Information Design

issuer.summary: issued by University of Colorado Colorado Springs

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of TCID 3140: ITERATIVE DESIGN PROJECTS - Familiarizes students with the foundational usability principles of creating, testing, revising and recreating products for maximum communication effectiveness. Students practice the process with multiple deliverables, paying careful attention to project management techniques for print, visual, and digital communication contexts.

Successful completion of TCID 3650: DATA VISUALIZATION - Explores how to transform complex data into compelling graphic presentations that aid with decision-making. Students learn about visual theories and evaluate the effectiveness of visualization designs before preparing their own suite of data visualizations.

Successful completion of TCID 4080: INFORMATION ARCHITECTURE - Prepares students to effectively structure complex information spaces for findability and usability through effective content management strategies such as navigation systems, structured vocabularies, and tagging schemes. Students learn the methods of modular content re-use for presentation and publication for different needs and audiences.

30f9af46-4744-4196-98c6-3b25e845efa3.description: The Inclusive Language and Interactions badge is part of the UDIT Program and is a comprehensive credential for proactively creating and inclusive learning experience. It represents the ability to assess and enhance the use of inclusive language and interactions within a learning environment. Earners have demonstrated competency in using inclusive prompts, statements, questions, and interactions during common learning experiences.
30f9af46-4744-4196-98c6-3b25e845efa3.name: UDIT | Inclusive Language and Interactions

issuer.summary: issued by University of Colorado Colorado Springs

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of all online modules, including all Products with an overall score of 85% or higher.
Implementation of Inclusive Teaching Strategy or Method into a course you teach
Evaluation of the Inclusive Teaching Strategy or Method
Presentation of the Inclusive Teaching Strategy or Method

bd4efec1-a363-47ec-b060-7c6480bdd617.description: Earners have an understanding of effective marketing necessary for the success of any business organization. Through the marketing efforts of a firm, products and services are designed and delivered that maximize customer satisfaction. The marketing curriculum is designed to give the student hands-on marketing experience through applied classes and projects. MKTG 6000 required then choose and complete 3 of 4 listed courses.
bd4efec1-a363-47ec-b060-7c6480bdd617.name: COB: Graduate Specialization Marketing

issuer.summary: issued by University of Colorado Colorado Springs

badge_template_activities.title: MKTG 6000 Marketing Strategy: Introduces the function and role of marketing in the firm, emphasizing the application of a broad range of marketing concepts. Marketing decisions are linked to business strategy using an integrated approach.

MKTG 6400 Service Marketing: Builds and expands on the MKTG 6000 course by showing adaptations and applications of marketing ideas to the service setting. This course focuses on the drivers of customer value and the unique challenges presented by services. Topics include the services marketing mix, customer expectations and satisfaction, service quality dimensions, service design, internal marketing and planning for services.

MKTG 6500 Integrated Marketing Communications (IMC) in the Digital Age: This course emphasizes practical managerial concepts for developing an effective communications program focusing heavily on today’s digital marketing channels. A focus on proper resource allocation and channel selection to maximize brand messages that build awareness, product/service knowledge, and help facilitate customer conversion.

MKTG 6700 Digital Marketing and Social Media Strategy: Provides a foundation and introduction into the strategy and tactics required for marketing in digital environments. The course focuses on key aspects of digital marketing currently used by professionals with particular attention given to the newest tools and techniques. Students apply concepts for real-world application in one of the most quickly changing business landscapes.

MKTG 6900 International Marketing & Export Management: Provides an overview of international marketing issues and a detailed analysis of each marketing mix element from a global perspective. Special emphasis is placed on managing the export function, how cultural differences impact marketing strategies and tactics, and on international marketing ethics.

fa7167d0-ce6f-49c5-b06c-3896d6be2c0a.description: The Teaching Enhancement Badge Program provides opportunities to research and apply innovative teaching strategies or practices to one’s own teaching. Faculty can explore effective pedagogical techniques and collaborate with colleagues to discuss student retention, engagement, and teaching to a new generation of students. Annually, faculty can create a Teaching Enhancement Plan that focuses on teaching goals and special interest tracks toward the completion of a digital badge.
fa7167d0-ce6f-49c5-b06c-3896d6be2c0a.name: Teaching Enhancement Badge Program

issuer.summary: issued by University of Colorado Colorado Springs

badge_template_activities.title: Creation of a Teaching Enhancement Plan to remain current in the subject area and profession of teaching that includes teaching goals, professional development plan related to a Special Interest Track, and implementation plan.

Participation in at least three professional development activities (for up to a total of 24 hours) that support your teaching goals with the submission of at least three self-reflection on what you learned and how you can apply it in a specific course you teach.

Satisfactory completion of a teaching toolbox of 3-5 interactions, activities, and assignments that address your Teaching Enhancement Plan as part of the Teaching Capstone with the achievement of greater than 85% of total points.
Satisfactory completion of a campus presentation as part of the Teaching Capstone with the achievement of greater than 85% of total points.

6c5d37f1-35c0-4aa6-a7b0-3499d44357c8.description: The Controversial Topics Facilitation badge is part of the UDIT Program and is a comprehensive credential for proactively creating an inclusive learning experience. It represents the ability to prepare and facilitate discussions of controversial topics. Earners have demonstrated competency in preparing oneself and content for difficult conversations, setting expectations or ground rules for having difficult conversations, and supporting students' emotional responses to such discussions.
6c5d37f1-35c0-4aa6-a7b0-3499d44357c8.name: UDIT | Controversial Topics Facilitation

issuer.summary: issued by University of Colorado Colorado Springs

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of all online modules, including all Products with an overall score of 85% or higher.
Implementation of Inclusive Teaching Strategy or Method into a course you teach
Evaluation of the Inclusive Teaching Strategy or Method
Presentation of the Inclusive Teaching Strategy or Method

80ddd281-23cf-4e22-8d81-92eb24b257c6.description: The Culturally Responsive Teaching badge is part of the UDIT Program and is a comprehensive credential for proactively creating inclusive learning experiences in a course or program. Earners have demonstrated competency in applying culturally responsive teaching strategies to course design and teaching practices, exercising self-awareness and commitment to inclusion, and improving student success.
80ddd281-23cf-4e22-8d81-92eb24b257c6.name: UDIT | Culturally Responsive Teaching

issuer.summary: issued by University of Colorado Colorado Springs

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of all online modules, including all Products with an overall score of 85% or higher.
Implementation of Inclusive Teaching Strategy or Method into a course you teach

afb016e3-b7af-4902-8b65-8daf90827ca3.description: Student Success Strategies is a part of the UDIT Program and is a comprehensive credential for proactively designing and implementing strategies to build a student's sense of belonging to a campus community. It represents the ability to support students' co-curricular development, foster relationships with and amongst students, and promote inclusion. Earners have demonstrated competency in fostering interpersonal relationships and inclusive instructional practices.
afb016e3-b7af-4902-8b65-8daf90827ca3.name: UDIT | Student Success Strategies

issuer.summary: issued by University of Colorado Colorado Springs

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of all online modules, including all Products with an overall score of 85% or higher
